definitions: To not believe something; to be skeptical of a claim or explanation.
To not accept an excuse or a story as true or valid.
examples: I don't buy it, his story has too many holes.
She tried to explain, but I just didn't buy it.
The jury didn't buy it, and he was found guilty.
He's trying to sell me a line, but I'm not buying it.
pastTenses: did not buy it, didn't buy it
